attributes.action: Take Political discrimination out of local council committee member selections
attributes.additional_details: Example : Majority political parties tend to side line professional opposition councillors who have expertise in favour of their own unskilled councillors onto committees who cannot possibly add value to  resulting in bad decisions and costing the public money, which is not beneficial to the local community - If this is made law it will optimise  skills  all elected councillors bring to local councils without political discrimination
attributes.background: Elected Councillors in local councils should be given first refusal who have relevant qualifications, skills and experience on committees the Councillor has a background in to optimise any local skill base to  the benefit of the council and the local community.

rejection.details: This is the responsibility of local councils, not the UK Government or Parliament.
